narratives.description:
Senior database administrators work as team leaders with computer engineering teams in order to create database architecture to accomplish the necessary goals of specialized computer software. Senior database administrators have very clear educational goals: they need a bachelor's degree in computer science or in similar fields. They will also need certification for database administration from an accredited board, such as Oracle. It is possible to forgo acquiring a bachelor's degree, but senior database administrators will require several years of work in similar areas as well as extensive self-education on database administration.
Senior database administrators need to know several programming languages in order to accomplish their goals. They will also need strong communication skills in order to delegate work goals and facilitate the creation and implementation of databases. 
Senior database administrators oversee the maintenance, configuration, and implementation of everything that has to do with databases. This includes the replication, backup, storage, access and partitioning of databases. Smooth and efficient installations, configurations, troubleshooting, and maintenance of database systems also fall onto the senior database administrator. When they are not installing or maintaining new database systems, senior database administrators must monitor and optimize their current systems to ensure quality system performance. They do this by utilizing index tuning, disk optimization, and various other methods that are appropriate. Within the confines of the database, senior database administrators must also determine who should have what permissions and privileges within the system to define who can access and control what information.
narratives.summaryHourly: The average pay for a Senior Database Administrator (DBA) is $63.27 per hour.
narratives.summarySalary: The average pay for a Senior Database Administrator (DBA) is $116,578 per year.

tasks: Design, architect, and build databases from determining business requirements.
Write and troubleshoot complex stored procedures.
Develop innovation, strategies, processes, and best practices.
Manage and mentor small team of DBAs.
Work closely with programming staff on database design changes to meet business requirements.

occupationalDetails.skills: Database Administration, Microsoft SQL Server, SQL, Oracle, Oracle 11g, Oracle DB 8i/9i/10g/ 11i, SQL Server Integration Services (SSIS), Oracle RAC, PL/SQL, Linux, Microsoft Word, Amazon Web Services (AWS), Internet Information Server (IIS), Windows NT / 2000 / XP Networking, Visual Basic (VB), IBM DB2, PostgreSQL, Microsoft Azure, SQL Server Reporting Services (SSRS), Windows Operating System General Use, Microsoft Office, MySQL, MongoDB, Development Operations (DevOps), UNIX, Teradata, Shell Scripting, Transact-SQL, Oracle Enterprise Manager (OEM), Database Architecture, Data Analysis, Apache Cassandra, Database Management, Database Management & Reporting, Windows PowerShell, Microsoft Access, Raiser's Edge Fundraising Software, Oracle GoldenGate, Oracle Exadata, Oracle 12i, Java, IBM Informix, Data Warehouse, Database, Microsoft Excel, Oracle Applications, Oracle eBusiness Suite, Business Intelligence, Cloud Computing, Database Development, Data Management, Python, Sybase Adaptive Server, SQL*DBA by Oracle, Windows Server 2012 R2, Salesforce, PeopleSoft, Performance Analysis, HTML, C# Programming Language, Big Data Analytics, DB2 MVS, Disaster Recovery, Epic Systems, ETL (Extract, transform, load), Network Management / Administration, IMS, Data Modeling, Data Mining, Oracle Fusion Middleware, SQLWindows, Job Control Language (JCL)

occupationalDetails.name: Senior Database Administrator (DBA)
